text:
He ended the misunderstanding with his sister so smoothly—just by reaching out his hand at the right moment and giving her that look. Those eyes! And his whole face is just stunning. Honestly, he’s even better looking than Dounia. But wow, that suit—what a disaster! Vasya, the messenger boy from Afanasy Ivanitch’s shop, is dressed better! I could just run up to him and hug him… maybe even cry. But I’m scared. Why am I scared? 🤔

“Oh, Rodya, you wouldn’t believe how unhappy Dounia and I were yesterday!” she blurted out, eager to share. “Now that it’s all behind us and we’re happy again, I can tell you. We rushed here straight from the train to see you and that woman—ah, there she is! Good morning, Nastasya! She told us you were sick with a high fever and had just run away from the doctor in a delirium. They were searching for you in the streets! You can’t imagine how we felt! I kept thinking about Lieutenant Potanchikov, a friend of your dad’s—you probably don’t remember him—who did the same thing when he had a fever and fell into a well. They couldn’t get him out until the next day. We totally freaked out. We almost ran to find Pyotr Petrovitch for help… because we felt so alone, completely alone,” she said, trailing off, suddenly remembering it was still risky to mention Pyotr Petrovitch, even though “we are quite happy again.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov's sister expresses her concern for him while reflecting on their recent struggles and the relief of being reunited.
